articles.author: Shinobi
articles.description:
Nostr is an alternative to Twitter that better protects users from censorship, and it‚Äôs built in a way that could appeal to Bitcoiners.
Nostr has gotten a lot of attention and steam behind it since its recent addition to the list of alternative social platforms that are prohibited from promotion on Twitter. And it‚Äôs also gaining traction as it‚Äôs become clear that the Twitter buyout by Elon Musk hasn't fundamentally changed anything about freedom of expression on the platform ‚Äî users are still being banned for inconsistent and arbitrary reasons, and people are looking for a decentralized alternative that isn't something like Mastodon, where a server operator still has the ability to control your identity. 
Despite the recent attention, the Nostr protocol and first relay server implementatio‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoiners Are Flocking To Nostr, But What Makes It Different Than Twitter?

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
The Tron-based stablecoin USDD fell below $1 parity again during the first week of 2023 and on Jan. 10. Four days ago, the stablecoin dropped to $0.972 per unit and on Tuesday, Jan. 10, 2023, USDD slipped to $0.977 per unit. At the time of writing, the Tron-issued stablecoin is trading at 98 cents per coin.
 
USDD Stablecoin Dips Down to 97 Cents per Token
 
There have been some slight fluctuations in USDD‚Äôs price at the start of the new year, as the stablecoin has dipped to the 97-cent range on a few occasions in 2023. After Terra‚Äôs stablecoin depegging event in May 2022, USDD started to slip slightly below the $1 peg, causing anxiety in the crypto industry. A number of other stablecoins saw similar deviations. On June 19, 2022, USDD reached a low of 92.8 cents per unit, but the stablecoi‚Ä¶
articles.title: Tron‚Äôs USDD Stablecoin Experiences Fluctuations Again, Drops Below $1 Parity in Early 2023

articles.author: Best Owie
articles.description:
Bitcoin‚Äôs price has taken a hit since it hit its all-time high back in 2021, and as a result, the number of bitcoin millionaires has dwindled dramatically since then. These addresses holding more than $1 million in BTC peaked in November 2021 and have been on a steady decline since then.
 
Bitcoin Millionaires Suffer Losses
 
Back in November 2021, when the bitcoin bull market was in full bloom, the number of BTC millionaires had crossed 100,000 wallets. At its highest point, there were 108,886 wallets with more than $1 million worth of BTC in their balances, but according to data from BitInfoCharts, this number has dropped below 25,000.
 
 
At a current count of 24,533 millionaire wallets, more than 77% of bitcoin investors with the millionaire status have been wiped out in a little over ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Over 77% Of Bitcoin Millionaires Wiped Out As Crypto Winter Rages

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
A newly-released study published in December 2022 reveals that South Korea‚Äôs ‚Äúkimchi premium,‚Äù the divergence in cryptocurrency valuations on Korean exchanges compared to Western trading platforms, is strongly associated with a surge in international remittances to China.
 
Examination of Overseas Remittances to China Uncovers Strong Correlation with South Korea‚Äôs ‚ÄòKimchi Premium‚Äô
 
According to a study conducted by Jangyoun Lee, an assistant professor at Incheon National University, and Taehee Oh of the Bank of Korea, South Korea‚Äôs kimchi premium appears to be significantly correlated with an influx of overseas remittances to China. The researchers note that the first instance of the kimchi premium in South Korea occurred in 2016, when there was high demand for bitcoin among Korean invest‚Ä¶
articles.title: Study Reveals South Korea‚Äôs ‚ÄòKimchi Premium‚Äô Strongly Linked to International Remittances to China

articles.author: David Atlee
articles.description:
The plaintiffs in a class action lawsuit against TerraUSD and its affiliated companies voluntarily dismissed their case on Monday.
 
Matthew Albright filed the lawsuit on behalf of others against Terraform Labs (TFL), Pte Limited, and other affiliates in the Southern District of New York Court in August 2022.
 
 
The plaintiffs alleged that the defendants falsely promoted, manipulated, and offered UST stablecoin and LUNA. Zhu Su, a cofounder of failed crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital (3AC), announced the voluntary dismissal of the class action lawsuit via a tweet on January 10.
 
Matthew Albright, the lead plaintiff in the case, filed a notice in Court stating a voluntary dismissal of the case against the defendants. The defendants include Terraform Labs, Do Kwon, Delphi Digital Cons‚Ä¶
articles.title: Terra And Do Kwon Lawsuit Voluntarily Dismissed, But Why?

U.S. law enforcement officials are reportedly scrutinizing Nishad Singh, the former director of engineering at FTX, according to a report citing people familiar with the matter. Another report, published on Jan. 10, 2023, details that Singh met with federal prosecutors at an alleged proffer session held at the U.S. attorney‚Äôs office for the Southern District of New York. Furthermore, federal prosecutors have disclosed that the investigation into alleged fraud at FTX and involving Sam Bankman-Fried is so expansive that the prosecutor‚Äôs office in the Southern District of New York could exhaust all of its resources.
 
Former FTX Director Nishad Singh Under Investigation by SDNY Prosecutors, Possible Cooperation Could Leave SBF Isolated
 
Five days ago, a report detailed that Nishad Singh, the‚Ä¶
articles.title: Former FTX Director of Engineering Under Scrutiny by US Law Enforcement, Alleged Proffer Sessions Held With Prosecutors in New York

articles.author: Reynaldo Marquez
articles.description:
Crypto Exchange Gemini co-founder, Cameron Winklevoss, sent another open letter regarding the Genesis borrowing agreement. This time, the executive addressed the Digital Currency Group (DCG) Board of Directors, Genesis‚Äô parent company.¬†
 
 
In the letter, Winklevoss accused the current DCG CEO, Barry Silbert, of allegedly conspiring and defrauding Gemini Earn users. Gemini offered the latter, which allowed users to obtain a yield by lending its crypto assets to Genesis.¬†
 
According to the document, Genesis was operating under a negative balance sheet for years. The crypto lender was allegedly affected by the collapse of one of its major partners, Three Arrows Capital (3AC). Winklevoss wrote:¬†
 

These parties (Silbert and others) conspired to make false statements and misrepresentations t‚Ä¶
articles.title: Winklevoss Goes On The Offensive, Gemini Earn Users Swindled By Barry Silbert?

articles.description:
ADA price is recovering after hovering around $0.25 for one month. The Cardano‚Äôs native token has fired up with a nearly 30% price surge since the advent of the New Year.
 
The hype around Cardano‚Äôs upcoming stablecoin DJED launch could be among the factors pushing ADA‚Äôs price forward. The news of Hoskinson‚Äôs new healthcare facility that would accept ADA as payment might have also contributed to the token‚Äôs mad surge.
 
ADA opened this week with almost a 10% increase in trading price, which has got Cardano‚Äôs founder, Charles Hoskinson, swelling with pride. Hoskinson took to Twitter and responded to comments about ADA‚Äôs skyrocketing price. He boasted that additional gains are coming with upcoming improvements on the Cardano Network.
 
According to Charles Hoskinson‚Äôs response tweet, the pro‚Ä¶

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
Gemini CEO Cameron Winklevoss has published another open letter on Twitter, addressed to the board members of Digital Currency Group (DCG). In the letter, Winklevoss accuses DCG and CEO Barry Silbert of making poor decisions with the now-defunct crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital (3AC), and claims that DCG orchestrated a ‚Äúcampaign of lies‚Äù in order to deceive Gemini and Earn users into thinking everything was fine. Winklevoss is demanding that the DCG board remove Silbert from his role as CEO, as Gemini believes ‚Äúthere is no path forward‚Äù with Silbert in charge.
 
Gemini and Digital Currency Group Dispute Continues With Another Open Letter
 
About a week ago, Bitcoin.com News reported on an open letter from Cameron Winklevoss, co-founder of the Gemini crypto exchange, to Digital Curren‚Ä¶
articles.title: Gemini Co-Founder Accuses Digital Currency Group of Misrepresentation, Demands CEO Resignation
